Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model

  • public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Model contains all of the functionality for the game Go-Moku. It is used by class Controller to empty the board, check for a winner, and check for valid moves.
    Author:
    Meghan Rogers, Nick Chua, Ewan Akins
    See Also:
    "No Borrowed Code"

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private char[][] board
      An array of characters to represent the game board.
      static int COLUMNS
      The number of columns on the game board.
      static int ROWS
      The number of rows on the game board.
      static int WIN_COUNT
      The number needed to win the game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Model()
      Constructor, creates 15x15 board of dashes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkWin(int i, int j, int turn)
      Checks for a winner of the game.
      java.awt.Point computerChoice(int i, int j)
      This method generates a random point for the computer to place "O" on the board, based on the user's previous move.
      void emptyBoard()
      Empties the board and initializes the board to dashes.
      void insertSymbol(int i, int j, int turn)
      Inserts the symbol onto the board.
      boolean validMove(int i, int j)
      Checks whether or not the move made is valid.

    • Method Detail

      • emptyBoard

        public void emptyBoard()
        Empties the board and initializes the board to dashes.

      • insertSymbol

        public void insertSymbol(int i,
                         int j,
                         int turn)
        Inserts the symbol onto the board.
        Parameters:
        i - the row of the symbol placement
        j - the column of the symbol placement
        turn - the turn variable (int) used to indicate who's turn it is

      • validMove

        public boolean validMove(int i,
                         int j)
        Checks whether or not the move made is valid.
        Parameters:
        i - the row of the symbol placement
        j - the column of the symbol placement
        Returns:
        boolean, true if the spot on the board is empty, false otherwise

      • checkWin

        public boolean checkWin(int i,
                        int j,
                        int turn)
        Checks for a winner of the game.
        Parameters:
        i - the row symbol placement
        j - the column of the symbol placement
        turn - the turn variable (int) used to indicate who's turn it is
        Returns:
        boolean, true if a winner is found, false otherwise

      • computerChoice

        public java.awt.Point computerChoice(int i,
                                     int j)
        This method generates a random point for the computer to place "O" on the board, based on the user's previous move.
        Parameters:
        i - the row of the symbol placed by the single player
        j - the column of the symbol placed by the single player
        Returns:
        Point, the random point generated by the computer
